user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_SHA512_256_init:
```c
void
MHD_SHA512_256_init (struct Sha512_256Ctx *ctx)
{
  /* Initial hash values, see FIPS PUB 180-4 clause 5.3.6.2 */
  /* Values generated by "IV Generation Function" as described in
   * clause 5.3.6 */
  ctx->H[0] = UINT64_C (0x22312194FC2BF72C);
  ctx->H[1] = UINT64_C (0x9F555FA3C84C64C2);
  ctx->H[2] = UINT64_C (0x2393B86B6F53B151);
  ctx->H[3] = UINT64_C (0x963877195940EABD);
  ctx->H[4] = UINT64_C (0x96283EE2A88EFFE3);
  ctx->H[5] = UINT64_C (0xBE5E1E2553863992);
  ctx->H[6] = UINT64_C (0x2B0199FC2C85B8AA);
  ctx->H[7] = UINT64_C (0x0EB72DDC81C52CA2);

  /* Initialise number of bytes and high part of number of bits. */
  ctx->count = 0;
  ctx->count_bits_hi = 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No suspicious fragments found. The function body contains only assignments of compile-time integer constants to structure members and simple integer initializations. There are no function calls (direct or indirect) within MHD_SHA512_256_init: UINT64_C is a standard integer-constant macro, not a function call, and there is no invocation through function pointers, callbacks, or other functions. Therefore there is no possibility of direct or indirect self-calling (recursion) in this code fragment and nothing needs further investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2.
